content:
Pokiaľ sa žiadosť stále zobrazuje, tak sa to dá rozchodiť RESETOVANÍM HESLA k Thunderbirdu. Resetovanie ale vymaže všetky uložené heslá v Thunderbirde. Je to preto, aby nedošlo k ľahkému získaniu ďalších hesiel neoprávnenou osobou. Pred týmto úkonom si vypíšte na papier všetky hesla z Thunderbirdu

Resetovanie hesla vykonajte takto: /b Otvorte ponuku "Nástroje/Chybová konzola" (CTRL+SHIFT+J) a do políčka "Kód:" vložte následujúci kód:

openDialog("chrome://pippki/content/resetpassword.xul")

Kliknite na "Vyhodnotiť" a potom sa otvorí dialógové okno pre odstránenie hlavného hesla.

http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/01/09/Thunderbird_chybova_konzola2.jpg
creator: Ansamb

creator: l.boscze

content:
METÓDA B (istá): Ručné zmazanie heslových súborov v profile. Toto funguje vo všetkých verziách, aj keď konzola nejde.

1️⃣ Zavri Thunderbird. Úplne — skontroluj, či nebeží na pozadí.

2️⃣ Otvor priečinok s profilom: Stlač Win + R a vlož: %APPDATA%\Thunderbird\Profiles Stlač Enter. Uvidíš priečinok s názvom napr. xxxxxxx.default-release.

3️⃣ V tomto priečinku nájdi a zmaž tieto súbory: key4.db (obsahuje šifrovací kľúč pre heslá) logins.json (uložené heslá) pkcs11.txt (nie je vždy prítomný, ale ak áno, môžeš zmazať) Nič iné nemaž.

4️⃣ Spusti Thunderbird. Nebude mať žiadne uložené heslá ani hlavné heslo — systém sa vráti do čistého stavu.

❗ Čo sa stane po resete? Hlavné heslo bude zrušené. Všetky uložené heslá (IMAP/SMTP, kalendár, doplnky) budú vymazané. Po prvom prihlásení bude Thunderbird znova žiadať heslá k účtom.
creator: Ansamb

content: Zkus toto: • Zavři Thunderbird Ve Windows pak Start - Spustit - zadat: thunderbird.exe -chrome chrome://pippki/content/resetpassword.xhtml Bude zrušeno Hlavní heslo a taky všechna uložená hesla v Thunderbirdu!
creator: poljos-moz

content:
Hi Klaus,

The message is coming from your e-mail service provider. They are blocking your mail. You should ask them why. One common reason is that the user (you) or someone sharing the same server for web hosting has been blacklisted because of spam.
creator: mozilla98

content:
Hi Kevin,

I do not use gmail, but I understand that this is the nature of All Mail. It shows messages that have been marked for deletion because it is designed to show ... all mail.

People recommend not subscribing to All Mail in Thunderbird because it significantly increases storage requirements and creates issues such as this one.

To unsubscribe, right click on the account name in the folder pane, select "Subscribe", and de-select All Mail.

You could also delete messages immediately instead of marking them for deletion. Shift-delete.
creator: mozilla98

content:
Do you have a test replacement set in your Mac's system settings? Maybe you set up a text replacement for your address to save yourself time typing it.

If so, go to system settings > Keyboard > Text input > Text replacements and delete it.

Or maybe you are using an add-on in Thunderbird such as Clippings to manage text clippings?
creator: mozilla98

content:
That solved it - thanks, Rick.

It was an automatic text replacement in system settings. I have no idea how that got set up. It just started happening a couple of days ago. I deleted that replacement and everything is back to normal.

content:
First, go to TB menu > General > Updates and change 'Allow Thunderbird to' to 'Check for updates, but let me choose whether to install them'. Then

- open your profile folder: TB menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information

- under the Application Basics section next to Profile Folder, click 'Open folder'

- close TB

- install the ESR version from https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/

- close the install dialog - don't start TB from there

- delete the compatiblity.ini file in the already-opened profile folder

- start TB
creator: siffemoz

content: Thank you very much, Ed. I've read that when switching from the Release version (more frequently updated) to the ESR version (behind release, version-wise), one must take certain steps to ensure that the (newer) release profile can be read by the (older) ESR version otherwise it will not be compatible with ESR. Perhaps you've covered that concern with your instructions to "delete compatibility.ini file"), but just want to make sure. Also, I've read that one can simply copy the Thunderbird folder under Roaming at %appdata% and simply copy that into a newly installed ESR version. Would that also work? Would it cover the profile compatibility issue?
creator: dp29

content:
> Perhaps you've covered that concern with your instructions to "delete compatibility.ini file"

Yes.

> copy %appdata%\Roaming\TB into a newly installed ESR version. Would that also work?

Yes, but there is no need to unless you want to use both release and esr.

> Would it cover the profile compatibility issue?

Yes, but only after you delete compatibility.ini.

content:
Hi,

You have posted several messages saying that Thunderbird has no means to do things that it does indeed have means to do. You may want to spend more time becoming familiar with the app. Much good information is available here:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/products/thunderbird

To set a signature, go to account settings and click on the account name in the left pane. You will see a space for a signature in the right pane. If you add identities, you can also add a unique signature for each identity.
